comments.commentBody: Mr.Cohn deserves "une fleur " for his astute observations. I have always had the hunch that only with a mass revolt of "petits blancs,"who have not had the advantages that the liberal elites of this country, many of whom contribute to the "Comments" of the paper, have had, will DT win the Presidency. This is the socio economic group which supports him, and must turn out to vote if Trump hopes to win the Presidency. Necessary differences observed.these r the same folk who supported Pierre Poujade in France in early 1950's, and whose party, UDCA, l'Union pour la defense des commercants et Artisans, won seats in the Senate and became a powerful force in national politics.(Jean Marie Le Pen and Demarquet were among Poujadist deputies to the National Assembly.) Poujade was considered a "low brow,"just as Trump is by his opponents, but the integrity of the man is outstanding, as the voters will see when he is inaugurated.Poujade's slogan was "Sortez les sortants," a variation of Trump's theme that it is time to overhaul Washington politics, and relegate the old guard, establishment politicians who, for all intents and purposes, appear now as troglodites, to a category of tertiary importance. To paraphrase Gramschi, an old way of life in Washington is dying,,and a new one, incarnated by Trump, is struggling to be born."Que la lutte continue!"

That white working class men trust the Republicans is beyond foolish. On the other hand, why should they trust the Democrats, who gave them NAFTA and whose current POTUS is pushing for the TPP? Who bailed out the bankers while those workers lost their homes?

Imagine what the working class could accomplish if it left behind the racism and focused on a few agenda items. Oh, would we have a different world, a different nation and just plain happier working class white men. What a wonderful life that would be.

Unfettered immigration good or bad for "white men without a college degree?" NAFTA the TPP and globalization effects on manufacturing jobs good or bad for "white men without a college degree?" Lower taxes good or bad for "white men without a college degree?" Cleaning up the Department of Veterans Affairs good or bad for "white men without a college degree?" Donald Trump's positions on all of the above issues good or bad for "white men without a college degree?" You don't have to be a rocket scientist to see why "white men without a college degree" support Donald Trump for president, just go over to to union halls such as the plumber's union, the carpenter's union, speak to the members there many of whom have actually worked on Donald Trump's projects and they will echo his thoughts practically verbatim. Just when many well paying manufacturing and construction jobs were being opened up to minorities and union memberships were becoming more diverse many of these good jobs went to illegal immigrants or were shipped overseas. And you wonder why "white men without a college degree" support Donald Trump for President? Really?

The author here vastly overstates the percentage of voters in 2012 that were white, working-class. He puts the number at 44%. It was more likely around 36%, and will probably drop to about 34% this time. Consider that the non-white share of the vote will be around 30%, and it is clear that whites with college degrees might very well decide this election. As of right now, that trend would appear to benefit Hillary Clinton.
http://www.npr.org/2016/01/18/462027861/republicans-white-working-class-...

The more that is written and said about Trump being an idiot and completely unqualified for the presidency, the more some people, such a white men with less formal education, will support him. This is the "stick it in your face" vote, the voters who are motivated to vote for Trump simply because the educated, supposedly sophisticated urban dwellers are for Hillary and so adamantly opposed to Trump.

This is a segment of the electorate, I fear, who can not be addressed on the issue directly. They have made up their minds and they don't care if the hottie toddy big shots say that Trump could lead us into a nuclear war or other lesser disasters. They don't care if he is unqualified. They might even admire his "success" by sleeping with dozens of women (who knows how many?), hanging out at the drug fueled palace of excess, Studio 54, in the 1980s and having three wives with children from each. Hey, these are the dreams of some people you could meet in a down and out bar across America on any given night. They admire him for getting away with things they would like to have done and raking money, too.

Don't assume that people without college degrees are stupid. Some might be poorly informed and less inclined to look at facts over fantasy, but the presence of a four yr. degree doesn't exactly confer genius status, does it?

Something will have to happen to shake their faith in Trump. He has been very lucky to date, but my bet is that something will break against him before Nov.

There's a disconnect when someone asks for respect for their views, and then goes on to propound views that are false or illogical by any rational or objective measure. It's the same disconnect whether they are a Bernie Bro or a Joe Six-Pack.

Old white men are, well, a little slower and even dumber than the average woman.  But, sooner ir later, even the dombest of dumb old white man begins to recoginise that Trump spends his to me in tanning beds and spraying hair spray.

White voters, and particularly white men without a college degree, support Trump?

Ok, I'll say it. Stupid voters do stupid things. Education is the solution to many of the world's problems!

Trumpa de-do-da
Trumpa de-aye,
My oh my, what a wonderful day;
Plenty of sunshine coming our way...
Trumpa de doo-dah,
Trumpa de aye.

Voter self-interest be damned, older white guys seething with resentment look at television images of the Democratic National Convention and see event moderators and state party chairs represented by women, people of color or both at the same time, so they just go ballistic. Their world of unmerited good ole boy dominance is slipping away and they cannot stand it.

Old, overweight guys with potty mouths and the emotional maturity of seven year-olds will be inclined to vote for one of his own. No matter if the candidate proves incapable of finishing a coherent thought and whose tactics consist of schoolyard taunts, The Donald is their guy. He is one of the gang. He may make them feel good for a few weeks but after that, it'll be nothing.

www.endthemadnessnow.org

Nate I realize you work for The Times but the implication that only dumb white guys are voting for Trump is disingenuous at best. Everyone I know with the exception of some of my Israel First friends are voting for Trump as the lesser of two evils and with the exception of one successful business owner my friends are physicians and academics, hardly representative of the "uneducated white males" you suggest, quite the reverse actually.
Sanders supporters and those who actually know something of the Clintons history, aside from thirty second sound bites and the best P.R. a billion dollar campaign chest can buy are overwhelmingly deserting the Democratic Party, the past year and the shenanigans of D.W.S. and Co. has put an exclamation point on just how corrupt the party has become. The only way to remake the Democrats into what they once were is to crush the neocons now in charge and that would certainly include Hillary, muddle through four years of an ineffectual President and hope for better options in 2020. That represents a much better option than four years of Hillary the Hawk waging wars both litteral and economic for her donor class of A.I.P.A.C. and Wall Street interests.

You can just about take these statistics and write "2008" and change the names to Clinton vs Obama. It's funny how "white men without a college degree" tend to have an average income of $72,000 per year- and these are the "forgotten" people? It was about race then and it's about race now.

http://fivethirtyeight.com/features/the-mythology-of-trumps-working-clas...

The best Hillary can do is to be explicit and down to earth as possible about her policy plans. When she talks about a Tobin tax on transactions, she needs to be concrete and specific and show that she wants to remove the volatility from the market while respecting it role as generator of investment money for business. But, her actual proposal was so vague as to be inconclusive. Similarly, she is both for and against TPP
"The Trans Pacific Partnership... But as of today, I am not in favor of what I have learned about it. I don't believe it's going to meet the high bar I have set for creating jobs and advancing national security. I am also worried about currency manipulation ... pharmaceutical companies may have gotten more benefits from the deal than their patients."
I am glad she has a high bar and is worried but what is her actual plan? She must be explicit and make strong detailed promises - because it shows intent. This is where she could really beat Trump - to actually demonstrate repeatedly everyday that she is a down to earth "policy wonk" - rather than just telling us she is a policy wonk.

Another manufactured NY Times narrative to try to demean the candidate they do not support.  I guess it takes a college degree to go from flat broke to $100 million while in public office, selling influence laundered through a "foundation". Deleting the evidence, and rigging the DNC to grab power.... If THAT is being a "educated", I'll pass. A choice between Trump and Clinton is no choice at all. I'm going to stay home on election day. Join me and send a message to the insiders that the system is rigged and must change.

The demographic group of non-degreed white men are a strength of this country. They shoulder many responsibilities; have jobs, support families, own small businesses, pay taxes, and pay for their children's college education. Many are ex-military, which is a good thing unless you desire to be invaded. All of that is tough, lifelong responsibility. I'm a degreed female who has electricity, running water and sewer services, paved roads, buildings to live and work in, food and gas that was trucked and railroaded from farm/factory/plant, a well-running automobile, bridges to get to the other side of town, wireless internet in my home so I can read Nate Cohn's article, and much more because that's the kind of thing this demographic group makes possible. I do not claim that only white men provide these things or do this work, but I do claim that men like this know the value of a dollar, and perhaps this is why they have turned to Trump - not because he is Trump but because he is not a Democrat. Dems have run up a staggering national debt that makes one wonder if their next suggestion will have to be a 1-child policy.

Now, I don't want to hear howling from women that they work too, because I work extremely hard for what I have. I just think that this group does not deserve to be looked at with an elitist eyeball, calling their choice of candidate a psychological failing. No matter who you are or how you cut it, these men deserve respect.

I'm currently reading the late Joe Bageant's "Deer Hunting with Jesus," which is about his return to his hometown in Virginia after a 30-year absence.

While it was written during the Bush administration, it says a lot about the appeal of the Red-Haired Republican, and I think it is a must for anyone interested in learning about the unacknowledged class system in this country.
Education makes you choose wisely, who would have thought!
You don't get to tell someone else what their self-interests should be.  The Democratic Party needs to reach out to this undervalued voting block.

I agree with commentators that The Message needs to be that the Republicans have  failed in every way to support the working class. It is not just Trump that is to be feared, but the Republican party itself, which has been hijacked by its fringe. Beyond the presidential election, people need to VOTE DEMOCRAT.

When Trump says he loves the poorly educated he means it.  They just happen to be the prime targets for his phony business at multiple levels, including everything from the hordes of small sub-contractors he has stiffed while enriching himself at their expense to the poor souls who believed Trump U had something to offer them in exchange for the steep "tuition" they were persuaded to pay.  I can think of no other demographic more susceptible to being conned and I am certain Trump has seen it the same way for a very long time.

I hope the white men they call uneducated wake up and see Mr Trump for what he's doing for them and that it nothing I hope they read more than just look at tv or listen too the talk radio and do search discover who's the best candate for this country I donot understand they let him them that American it weak knows better than  that the people in UK was feed with false information . Also look what's going too happen.

Trump would use these poor guys just like he did the people who signed up for Trump University ! Hillary would actually invest in major infrastructure jobs which would benefit them.  If these guys had actually listened to Bernie and Hillary they would realize they are on their side not circus, carney Trump !  Expanding Medicare, a public option, negotiated drug prices, making college affordable ... all of these are a priority for Hillary, not Trump ! Trump thinks Putin is a good leader and role model ... this should make the white, uneducated male seriously think long and hard promoting someone as unethical as Trump !  He tells these guys whatever they want to hear, they need to use their street smarts and demand Trump release his tax returns to see what he is hiding.

These poll numbers are simply reflective of the winners and losers of 20 or more years of globalization. Income among non degreed Americans - across the demographic spectrum - have fallen over the past two to three decades, whereas incomes of degreed and especially advanced degreed Americans have increased both absolutely and in relative terms. There has been a bifurcation of gains on a regional basis with both coasts gaining at the expense of the hinterland. Politics typically follows the pocketbook and this is readily evident here.
What I find perplexing is the extent to which those least harmed by globalization (those who typically post on this board) opinionate in a self righteous, moralizing way about those who are. People need to understand that this phenomenon is not about Trump; the long term fruition of the Nixon strategy; or anything of the sort. Its simply a reflection of globalization and its discontents.
Middle Aged blue collar whites are one portfolio away, along with empathetic professor, from transforming worthy life experiences into Associates Degree.
